{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thyroglossal duct cyst is a congenital anomaly that occurs due to the persistence of the thyroglossal duct during embryonic development. It typically presents as a midline neck mass, most commonly in the region of the hyoid bone. The cyst is lined by stratified squamous or pseudostratified columnar epithelium. It can become infected, leading to the formation of an abscess. Therefore, the false statement about thyroglossal duct cyst is option C, which states that 40% of cases have a subhyoid location.", "answer_choice": "C"}
